column2: The branch of the repo to continuously deploy.
The sample service that is being continuously deployed.
The continuous deployment pipeline in the AWS Management Console.
Token for the user specified above. (https://github.com/settings/tokens)

[{u'Parameters': [u'LaunchType'], u'Label': {u'default': u'Cluster Configuration'}}, {u'Parameters': [u'GitHubRepo', u'GitHubBranch', u'GitHubUser', u'GitHubToken'], u'Label': {u'default': u'GitHub Configuration'}}, {u'Parameters': [u'TemplateBucket'], u'Label': {u'default': u'Stack Configuration'}}]
The repo name of the sample service.

The launch type for your service. Selecting EC2 will create an Auto Scaling group of t2.micro instances for your cluster. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/launch_types.html to learn more about launch types.
The S3 bucket from which to fetch the templates used by this stack.
